titleStmt.title: Structure of Pseudomonas aeruginosa quorum sensing protein LasR bound to the autoinducer C 12 -HSL

analytic.title: Structure of Pseudomonas aeruginosa quorum sensing protein LasR bound to the autoinducer C 12 -HSL

application.desc: GROBID - A machine learning software for extracting information from scholarly documents

div.head: Introduction
div.p: Pseudomonas aeruginosa is an opportunistic human pathogen responsible for the death of most cystic fibrosis sufferers and many other immunocompromised patients. Fatality is caused by numerous virulence factors, whose production follows activation of the Pseudomonas aeruginosa quorum sensing protein LasR by the autoinducer (AI) C 12 -HSL. In order to understand the basis for ligand binding and specificity and to obtain atomic level information for rational design of small molecules inhibitors of LasR activation we have expressed and crystallized its ligand binding domain.

div.head: Data Collected
div.p: The LasR ligand binding domain-AI complex has been crystallized in the monoclinic P2 1 space group with unit cell parameters a = 53.88 Å, b = 85.16 Å, c = 75.67 Å and β = 95.81°. The crystals asymmetric unit containes 4 monomers corresponding to approximately 42% (V/V) of solvent content. Three native data sets were collected. The best data set extends to 1.8 Å resolution.
The Selenomethionine substituted protein has been prepared and the structure will be solved by the SAD/MAD method.
